articles.title: Why Days On Earth Getting Longer? Climate Change Affecting Earth's Rotation - NewsX
articles.description:
As ice sheets melt at the Earth’s poles, the mass that used to be in ice is moving into the oceans. This shift is changing the shape of the Earth slightly, which affects the pace of planet spin.

articles.title: Baby animals that look nothing like their parents - The Times of India
articles.description: ​It’s astonishing how some baby animals look entirely different from their adult counterparts. These dramatic transformations showcase nature’s incredible diversity and the fascinating journey from infancy to adulthood.
articles.content: Baby platypuses, or puggles, are born without the distinctive beak. They are tiny, hairless, and blind at birth, unlike the peculiar, duck-billed adults they will become.
